contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{Use Australian English|date=August 2012}} {{Infobox Australian place | type = town | name = Yellowdine | state = wa | image = | caption = | lga = [[Shire of Yilgarn]] | latd =31 |latm =18|lats =00 | longd =119|longm =39 |longs =00 | postcode = 6426 | est = 1935 | pop = 14 | elevation= 356 | maxtemp = | mintemp = | rainfall = | stategov = [[Electoral district of Eyre|Eyre]] | fedgov = [[Division of O'Connor|O'Connor]] | dist1 = 402 | dir1 = East | location1= [[Perth, Western Australia|Perth]] | dist2 = 33 | dir2 = East | location2= [[Southern Cross, Western Australia|Southern Cross]] | dist3 = | dir3 = | location3= }} '''Yellowdine''' is located 402 km east of [[Perth, Western Australia|Perth]], [[Western Australia]] on the [[Great Eastern Highway]]. The townsite is in the [[Goldfields-Esperance region of Western Australia|goldfields region]], situated in the [[Shire of Yilgarn]]. == History == The town was initially planned in 1895 as a railway siding along the Coolgardie to Southern Cross railway line that was opened in 1896. Once gold was discovered at [[Mount Palmer, Western Australia|Mount Palmer]] close to Yellowdine in 1934 the government began to develop the siding as a town-site that was later gazetted in 1935.<ref>{{LandInfo WA|y|Y|2007-06-08}}</ref> The name of the town is believed to be Aboriginal in origin, a misspelling of Yelladine, although its meaning is unknown. == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Towns in Western Australia]] [[Category:Australian Aboriginal place names]] {{WesternAustralia-geo-stub}}
